bioghist.p: The Eighth Street-Wayside Mission was the formed by the union of the Eighth Street M.E. Mission and Wayside Presbyterian Mission in 1927. It was conducted by a joint committee of ten: five Methodists and five Presbyterians. During the summer months, the Mission was supported by the Summer Evangelistic Committee, and during the rest of the year by the Trustees of the Presbytery of Philadelphia. The Mission conducted evangelistic meetings and street meetings, a Sunday school and welfare work for residents of the neighborhood.

scopecontent.p: This collection contains minutes of quarterly meetings, 1927-1946 of the Eighth Street-Wayside Mission Committee, which include reports by members of the committee, including the treasurer, and reports on the activities of the Mission; and legal documents, such as an agreement of union between Eighth Street M.E. Rescue Mission and Wayside Mission, 1927, and leases, 1948 and 1956. There are several printed reports of the Presbytery of Philadelphia, Committee on National Missions, 1936-1943, and also some correspondence about the merger of the two missions, 1927.
